decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells and then bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. Utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Manamorphose, and Thought Scour to fuel the graveyard, while also using cheap spells like Gut Shot and Lightning Bolt to control the board. The deck also includes creatures like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake for additional threats and versatility. It aims to be aggressive and explosive, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and Bedlam Reveler. Utilizing low-cost spells like Lava Spike, Faithless Looting, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to deal consistent damage while keeping a high tempo. Monastery Swiftspear provides early pressure while cards like Tormenting Voice and Manamorphose help cycle through the deck. The inclusion of burn spells like Gut Shot and Fiery Temper allows the deck to close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and consistent damage output.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to keep the opponent's threats in check. It also includes card draw spells to maintain card advantage and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide additional card advantage and win conditions. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own resources to eventually take control of the game and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on using cards that allow the player to rapidly reduce their own life total in order to pump up the power of Death's Shadow. The deck includes a mix of disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, along with removal and counter spells to protect the Death's Shadow once it hits the board. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler to provide additional threats and card advantage, making it a fast-paced and aggressive deck that aims to win the game quickly.

This Jund deck utilizes a combination of discard spells, removal, and versatile threats to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck aims to control the board through efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, while also utilizing hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Additionally, the deck includes strong threats like Tarmogoyf, Bloodbraid Elf, and Dark Confidant to close out the game quickly. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its aggressive game plan and ensure consistent access to its powerful spells.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while using powerful planeswalkers to dominate the late game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, while countering key spells with Mana Leak and Cryptic Command. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides card advantage and control over the board, while Celestial Colonnade serves as a win condition. Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage offer additional value and disruption, making the deck a formidable force in a 1 vs 1 matchup.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. Jeskai Control aims to stabilize the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict, while using counterspells like Logic Knot and Cryptic Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides card advantage and tempo advantage, allowing the player to pull ahead in resources. Snapcaster Mage is used to recur key spells from the graveyard for additional value. The deck's win condition often comes from overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and efficient removal.

The deck revolves around utilizing Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate infinite mana by sacrificing artifacts and looping key pieces like Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever. This enables the player to draw their entire deck with Ichor Wellspring and eventually win the game with unlimited mana. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Mox Opal, while also providing utility with cards like Engineered Explosives and Sai, Master Thopterist. The mana base includes lands that help with color fixing and recursion, creating a consistent combo deck with multiple win conditions.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's hand while setting up explosive plays with Death's Shadow. By utilizing low-cost discard spells and cantrips, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also filling its graveyard to power out a massive Death's Shadow. With a combination of removal spells and counterspells to protect its threats, the deck looks to close out games quickly with aggressive creatures like Gurmag Angler and Death's Shadow. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and disruption to overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board of aggressive spirit creatures while disrupting the opponent with tempo plays like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit. By utilizing Aether Vial and Collected Company, the deck can efficiently deploy threats while keeping up mana for interaction. With lords like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent with flying spirits that grow in power. The deck also includes efficient removal like Path to Exile to handle opposing threats, making it a potent and consistent aggro deck in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with mass removal spells like Wrath of God and Day of Judgment, while using Martyr of Sands to gain a large amount of life. This allows the deck to sustain until it can bring out powerful threats like Serra Ascendant and Emeria, the Sky Ruin. Cards like Ranger of Eos and Proclamation of Rebirth help to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to outlast opponents with a combination of life gain and powerful creatures.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to aggressively apply pressure on the opponent using powerful Eldrazi creatures. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail, while also ensuring consistent mana with Gemstone Caverns and Zhalfirin Void. It includes a suite of Eldrazi creatures that not only hit hard but also offer value by providing additional cards or resources when they enter the battlefield or are cast. The deck also utilizes Serum Powder and Eternal Scourge to maximize its card advantage and resiliency.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate large amounts of mana to play big threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Karn Liberated. It also utilizes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to disrupt the opponent and maintain board control. With a mix of ramp, removal, and powerful threats, the deck aims to overpower the opponent and win through its high impact cards and mana advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up an infect creature, such as Glistener Elf or Blighted Agent, and use pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to deal lethal poison damage to the opponent. Protection spells like Spellskite and Blossoming Defense help to keep the infect creatures safe from removal spells. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, unblockable infect damage before they have a chance to respond. The deck aims to win the game through the infect mechanic rather than traditional combat damage.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using artifacts and cards that disrupt your opponent's strategies. By using cards like Whir of Invention and Mox Opal, you can search for key artifacts to lock down the board and prevent your opponent from executing their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Chalice of the Void further solidifies your control over the game, while also providing protection for yourself. Overall, this deck focuses on stalling the game and controlling the tempo until you can secure a win condition.

The main focus of the deck is to utilize fast, evasive infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf along with pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Groundswell to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense to protect your creatures from removal spells. The goal is to win the game in a single turn by overwhelming the opponent with infect damage before they have a chance to respond.
